LayoutNode.Content: (CNN) ? The rest of the political world is easing down for the July Fourth holiday, but President Donald Trump is in the middle of a midterm election preview, juicing his political base and baiting Democrats as "radical" leftists who are soft on crime and immigration.
LayoutNode.SRC: (CNN)<XPspan class="Xanonymous" style="display:inline"> ? </XPspan>The rest of the political world is easing down for the July Fourth holiday, but PresidentDonald Trump is in the middle of a midterm election preview, juicing his political base and baitingDemocrats as "radical" leftists who are soft on crime and immigration.

LayoutNode.Content: The President, who clearly thinks he's on a roll, is back in Washington to crank up the theatricsbefore unveiling his second Supreme Court pick next week after spending the weekend stoking anangry mood among supporters with bold, inflammatory rhetoric on immigration.
LayoutNode.SRC: The President, who clearly thinks he's on a roll, is back in Washington to crank up the theatrics before unveiling his second Supreme Court pick next week after spending the weekend stoking an angry mood among supporters with bold, inflammatory rhetoric on immigration.

LayoutNode.Content: "Focus will be on the selection of a new Supreme Court Justice. Exciting times for our country.Economy may be stronger than it has ever been!" Trump said in an upbeat tweet as he headedback to the White House from his New Jersey golf resort.
LayoutNode.SRC: "Focus will be on the selection of a new Supreme Court Justice. Exciting times for our country. Economy may be stronger than it has ever been!" Trump said in an upbeat tweet as he headed back to the White House from his New Jersey golf resort.

LayoutNode.Content: Naming a replacement for Anthony Kennedy, who announced his retirement last week, will allowTrump to argue in November to social conservatives who swallowed qualms about his characterto help put him in the White House that their gamble has been richly rewarded.
LayoutNode.SRC: Naming a replacement for Anthony Kennedy, who announced his retirement last week, will allow Trump to argue in November to social conservatives who swallowed qualms about his character to help put him in the White House that their gamble has been richly rewarded.

LayoutNode.Content: Trump also tore at opening seams of division in the Democratic Party, several times using hisTwitter megaphone to accuse his opponents of diving sharply to the left, giving an early glimpse ofthe kind of turnout-boosting strategy he hopes will stave off a blue wave in November.
LayoutNode.SRC: Trump also tore at opening seams of division in the Democratic Party, several times using his Twitter megaphone to accuse his opponents of diving sharply to the left, giving an early glimpse of the kind of turnout-boosting strategy he hopes will stave off a blue wave in November.

LayoutNode.Content: "The Liberal Left, also known as the Democrats, want to get rid of ICE, who do a fantastic job, andwant Open Borders. Crime would be rampant and uncontrollable! Make America Great Again,"Trump wrote in a tweet that garnered 106,000 likes by Sunday evening.
LayoutNode.SRC: "The Liberal Left, also known as the Democrats, want to get rid of ICE, who do a fantastic job, and want Open Borders. Crime would be rampant and uncontrollable! Make America Great Again," Trump wrote in a tweet that garnered 106,000 likes by Sunday evening.

LayoutNode.Content: The tweets crystallized Trump's emerging midterm election message, which is designed toconfound historic portents that first term presidents rarely get the same kind of turnout in themidterms as they enjoyed in their own euphoric election wins.
LayoutNode.SRC: The tweets crystallized Trump's emerging midterm election message, which is designed to confound historic portents that first term presidents rarely get the same kind of turnout in the midterms as they enjoyed in their own euphoric election wins.

LayoutNode.Content: By constantly hyping the threat of undocumented migrants, Trump understands that he can getright into the bloodstreams of his most loyal supporters on an issue that animated his electioncampaign more than anything else.
LayoutNode.SRC: By constantly hyping the threat of undocumented migrants, Trump understands that he can get right into the bloodstreams of his most loyal supporters on an issue that animated his election campaign more than anything else.

LayoutNode.Content: By castigating the "liberal left" and seizing on calls by some prominent Democrats, including someof his potential 2020 opponents, for the abolition of the Immigration and Customs Enforcementagency, Trump can paint his opponents as extreme and weak on national security.
LayoutNode.SRC: By castigating the "liberal left" and seizing on calls by some prominent Democrats, including some of his potential 2020 opponents, for the abolition of the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency, Trump can paint his opponents as extreme and weak on national security.

LayoutNode.Content: Turning the focus to ICE also helps Trump muddy the debate about his administration's unpopularseparations policy that slipped out of the news last week, despite the fact few of the families splitup during the storm over the strategy have been reunited.
LayoutNode.SRC: Turning the focus to ICE also helps Trump muddy the debate about his administration's unpopular separations policy that slipped out of the news last week, despite the fact few of the families split up during the storm over the strategy have been reunited.

LayoutNode.Content: The loaded language that Trump is again using on immigration is a sign that despite being forcedto backtrack on separations, he has no intention of easing the temperature on an issue that hasrepeatedly delivered for him.
LayoutNode.SRC: The loaded language that Trump is again using on immigration is a sign that despite being forced to backtrack on separations, he has no intention of easing the temperature on an issue that has repeatedly delivered for him.

LayoutNode.Content: "You are doing a fantastic job of keeping us safe by eradicating the worst criminal elements,"Trump told ICE agents in a tweet on Saturday.
LayoutNode.SRC: "You are doing a fantastic job of keeping us safe by eradicating the worst criminal elements," Trump told ICE agents in a tweet on Saturday.

LayoutNode.Content: "So brave! The radical left Dems want you out. Next it will be all police."
LayoutNode.SRC: "So brave! The radical left Dems want you out. Next it will be all police."

LayoutNode.Content: There were already signs on Sunday that pressure from Trump was making some Democratsuncomfortable about calls from prominent party figures for the eradication of ICE.
LayoutNode.SRC: There were already signs on Sunday that pressure from Trump was making some Democrats uncomfortable about calls from prominent party figures for the eradication of ICE.

LayoutNode.Content: Illinois Democratic Sen. Tammy Duckworth, speaking on CNN's "State of the Union," condemned the administration's "horrendous" separations policy but declined to join demands by some colleagues, including New York Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand and Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren, for ICE to be abolished.
LayoutNode.SRC: Illinois Democratic Sen. Tammy Duckworth, speaking on CNN's "State of the Union," condemned the administration's "horrendous" separations policycondemned the administration's "horrendous" separations policy but declined to join demands by somecolleagues, including New York Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand and Massachusetts Sen. ElizabethWarren, for ICE to be abolished.

LayoutNode.Content: "I think there's a lot of other things we can do before weget to that point," she said. Republican hopes of branding Democrats as out of themainstream also received a boost with the shock primaryvictory of self-declared democratic socialist AlexandriaOcasio-Cortez, who beat Democratic House leadershipveteran Joe Crowley last week. Trump's own efforts to wind up his political base and thefact that most of the energy in the Democratic Partyappears to be among ultra-progressives suggest howimportant the more radical elements in both parties willbe in shaping the midterm campaign.
LayoutNode.SRC:
"I think there's a lot of other things we can do before we get to that point," she said.
Republican hopes of branding Democrats as out of the mainstream also received a boost with the shock primary victory of self-declared democratic socialist Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, who beat Democratic House leadership veteran Joe Crowley last week.
Trump's own efforts to wind up his political base and the fact that most of the energy in the Democratic Party appears to be among ultra-progressives suggest how important the more radical elements in both parties will be in shaping the midterm campaign.

LayoutNode.Content: Related Article: Duckworth doesn't join Related Article: Dem colleagues in calls to abolish ICE Though Trump is currently relishing favorable politicalwinds, there were also hints of his vulnerability thisweekend.
LayoutNode.SRC:

Though Trump is currently relishing favorable political winds, there were also hints of his vulnerability this weekend.

LayoutNode.Content: Related Article: Who's next? Related Article: Progressive primary insurgents to watch He claimed after a call with the Saudi king that he hadsecured a boost in oil output as prices at the gas pumpbegin to sting. "Just spoke to King Salman of Saudi Arabia andexplained to him that, because of the turmoil &disfunction in Iran and Venezuela, I am asking that SaudiArabia increase oil production, maybe up to 2,000,000barrels, to make up the difference...Prices to (sp)high!He has agreed!" Trump tweeted on Saturday. But the White House later corrected that version ofevents. "In response to the President's assessment of a deficit inthe oil market, King Salman affirmed that the Kingdommaintains a two million barrel per day spare capacity,which it will prudently use if and when necessary toensure market balance and stability, and in coordination with its producer partners, to respond toany eventuality," the White House said in a statement.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Related Article: Who's next?Related Article: Progressive primary insurgents to watch
He claimed after a call with the Saudi king that he had secured a boost in oil output as prices at the gas pump begin to sting.
"Just spoke to King Salman of Saudi Arabia and explained to him that, because of the turmoil & disfunction in Iran and Venezuela, I am asking that Saudi Arabia increase oil production, maybe up to 2,000,000 barrels, to make up the difference...Prices to (sp)high! He has agreed!" Trump tweeted on Saturday.
But the White House later corrected that version of events.
"In response to the President's assessment of a deficit in the oil market, King Salman affirmed that the Kingdom maintains a two million barrel per day spare capacity, which it will prudently use if and when necessary to ensure market balance and stability, and in coordination with its producer partners, to respond to any eventuality," the White House said in a statement.

LayoutNode.Content: High gas prices could dampen the impact of the GOP tax cuts on the wallets or ordinaryAmericans and eat into consumer confidence ahead of an election Republicans are approachingwith a "peace and prosperity" message.
LayoutNode.SRC: High gas prices could dampen the impact of the GOP tax cuts on the wallets or ordinary Americans and eat into consumer confidence ahead of an election Republicans are approaching with a "peace and prosperity" message.

LayoutNode.Content: There are also fears among some Republicans thatTrump's escalating trade wars with China, NAFTApartners and the European Union could also dampenthe economy before November. On Sunday, Canada's national day, for instance, thegovernment in Ottawa responded to US steel andaluminum tariffs with nearly $13 billion of its own tradepunishments. More than 40 US steel products were hit by tariffs of25%. A tax of 10% was levied on over 80 other Americanitems including toffee, maple syrup, coffee beans andstrawberry jam.
LayoutNode.SRC:
There are also fears among some Republicans that Trump's escalating trade wars with China, NAFTA partners and the European Union could also dampen the economy before November.
On Sunday, Canada's national day, for instance, the government in Ottawa responded to US steel and aluminum tariffs with nearly $13 billion of its own trade punishments.
More than 40 US steel products were hit by tariffs of 25%. A tax of 10% was levied on over 80 other American items including toffee, maple syrup, coffee beans and strawberry jam.

LayoutNode.Content: Related Article: Gas prices are way too Related Article: high. Here's what Trump can do about it The "peace" tranche of the peace and prosperitymessage is also looking a little tenuous.
LayoutNode.SRC:

The "peace" tranche of the peace and prosperity message is also looking a little tenuous.

LayoutNode.Content: Reports over the weekend that North Korea had taken step s to either step up or hide production of nuclear materials and missiles contradicted Trump's claims after his summit with Kim Jong Un that he had solved the Stalinist state's nuclear threat.
LayoutNode.SRC: Reports over the weekend that North Korea had takensteps to either step up or hide production of nuclear materials and missiles contradicted Trump'sclaims after his summit with Kim Jong Un that he had solved the Stalinist state's nuclear threat.

LayoutNode.Content: As is so often the case, there were also signs of the alternative reality that Trump conjures up when the facts don't line up to his political advantage, as he claimed that he had never pushed House Republicans to vote on an ultimately doomed immigration bill , although he had, in fact, done exactly that only a few days earlier -- and the evidence is still in plain sight on his Twitter feed.
LayoutNode.SRC: As is so often the case, there were also signs of the alternative reality that Trump conjures upwhen the facts don't line up to his political advantage, as he claimed that he had never pushed House Republicans to vote on an ultimately doomed immigration billhe had never pushed House Republicans to vote on an ultimately doomed immigration bill, although he had, in fact,done exactly that only a few days earlier -- and the evidence is still in plain sight on his Twitterfeed.

He isincessantly nurturing his political base. But it also shows an increasingly confidentcommander-in-chief, unencumbered by restraininginfluences now that the more centrist and conventionalmembers of his original White House staff have mostlydeparted. That will be bad news for US allies abroad who are bracing for the President's next foray onto the global stage in less than two weeks, after his recent lashing out at the European Union and NATO, musings that
LayoutNode.SRC:
Related Article: Trump claims he neverRelated Article: pressured House GOP on immigrationRelated Article:
If nothing else, the hyperactive weekend at his golf resort proved that Trump is not going to be the kind of president who is so mired in running the country that he loses sight of his own political imperatives. He is incessantly nurturing his political base.
But it also shows an increasingly confident commander-in-chief, unencumbered by restraining influences now that the more centrist and conventional members of his original White House staff have mostly departed.
That will be bad news for US allies abroad who arebracing for the President's next foray onto the globalstage in less than two weeks, after his recent lashing outat the European Union and NATO, musings that
